meanings.definition: A plant of the pea family, grown as fodder and forage.
meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested fresh alfalfa for his cows.
meanings.sent2: The alfalfa field stretched out as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to sneak a bite of the alfalfa.
meanings.sent4: The alfalfa swayed gently in the breeze, a green sea of nutrition.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of alfalfa filled the barn, enticing the animals.

meanings.definition: The leaves or stems of this plant, used as food for livestock.
meanings.sent1: The cows happily munched on the fresh alfalfa.
meanings.sent2: The farmer loaded bales of alfalfa onto the truck for the horses.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit hopped over to nibble on the alfalfa leaves.
meanings.sent4: The alfalfa stems were like green sticks of deliciousness for the animals.
meanings.sent5: The goats eagerly gathered around the alfalfa, eager for their meal.

meanings.definition: A sprout of this plant, often used in salads.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a handful of alfalfa sprouts to the salad.
meanings.sent2: The crunchy texture of the alfalfa sprouts added a fresh element to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The playful squirrel tried to steal a sprout of alfalfa from the garden.
meanings.sent4: The alfalfa sprouts were like tiny bursts of flavor in the salad.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the alfalfa sprouts made the salad look even more appetizing.
